Navigation
Name Test/Libraries/util/Eval/eval
Synopsis Evaluate a (list of) Rascal commands and return the value of the last command.
Function
  1. value eval(str command) throws Timeout
  2. value eval(list[str] commands) throws Timeout
  3. value eval(str command, int duration) throws Timeout
  4. value eval(list[str] commands, int duration) throws Timeout
Usage import util::Eval;
Description Evaluate a command or a list of commands and return the value of the last command that is executed. An optional duration argument may be present to limit the time (in milliseconds) the execution may take. By default, the duration is set to 1000 ms.
Examples 
rascal>import util::Eval;
PROFILE: 1 data points, 52 ticks, tick = 1 milliSecs
 Source File      Lines   Ticks        %  Source
prompt:///          1      52   100.0%  |prompt:///|(0,18,<1,0>,<1,18>
ok
rascal>eval("2 * 3;");
